summary: The document is a classified message pertaining to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, focusing on the activities and travels of individuals linked to the Black Panther Party (BPP) and other figures of interest. It details the mistaken arrest of George Lorenzo Matthews by Tanzanian authorities, the movements of BPP members Felix Lindsay O'Neal and William Holder in Geneva, and the presence of James Joseph Patters and Nathaniel Jerome Burns in France. Additionally, it notes the residence of Pete O'Neal and his wife in Dar es Salaam with other BPP members and inquiries into the travels of certain individuals outside Algiers.
key_findings: George Lorenzo Matthews was mistakenly arrested by Tanzanian authorities in late December 1972, being confused for hijacker George Edward Wright.
Felix Lindsay O'Neal and William Holder, members of the BPP, were in Geneva before November 15, 1972, possibly traveling under their real names.
James Joseph Patters was in France with Nathaniel Jerome Burns, alias 'Sako', around December 13, 1972.
As of January 31, 1973, Pete O'Neal and his wife resided in Dar es Salaam with two other unidentified BPP members.
There was an effort to verify the travels of Wright and Holder outside Algiers and to gather any additional observations regarding their movements.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
